In FY 2017 PEPFAR/Malawi plans to engage CRS’ Coordinating Comprehensive Care for Children (4Children), to scale up OVC interventions. The aim is to expand the reach of OVC core activities to other scale-up districts not currently covered by One Community mechanism Thyolo, Lilongwe and Mzimba. PEPFAR Malawi’s OVC program objective is to ensure that Orphans and Vulnerable Children households receive quality care and support services. Therefore CRS through its 4Children will implement strategies that empower vulnerable families to provide care for themselves, including their children as outlined in the 2012 PEPFAR OVC guidance. The guidance prioritizes the need for developing family specific case plans and addressing needs of individual family members rather than one-size-fits-all approach and indicates how progress will be monitored. 4Children will implement case management OVC programming, treating both vulnerable children and their households as a case in and of itself. The child and family socio-economic status will be assessed across all areas of health, safety, protection, nutrition, care, shelter, stability, and education with the aim of determining their vulnerability levels. Interventions will be jointly developed as a case/care management plan for the children and families with monitoring of referral and completion within a specific period of time and measured against specific outcomes. The ultimate aim of this approach is to reduce vulnerability in the child and household and graduate families/households from dependency to self-sufficiency and children to resiliency.
